pages.text: Shards are a common material when sharpness is a priority. As such, you'll find them commonly in arrows, musket balls, and pikes.$(br2)Not all shards are used for their sharpness though. Some materials naturally break into shards, which is the case for items like Molten and Ventus ores.
Wooden shards can be obtained by breaking logs with a pickaxe. They're incredibly weak and are only useful for shoddy weaponry.
Stone shards can be obtained by placing cobblestone by itself in a crafting grid. Like wooden shards, these are only useful for low-quality items.
Diamond shards can be obtained by placing a diamond by itself in a crafting grid. They are quite sharp and constitute high-end weapons.
Obsidian shards can be obtained by placing an obsidian block by itself in a crafting grid. They're only used as a component of Molten ingots.
Molten shards are obtained from Molten ore rarely in the Nether. They're only used as a component of Molten ingots.
Ventus shards are obtained from Ventus ore, which is found rarely on Cloud Islands. All Ventus items require shards for crafting.
